subject: RE: [junit] failSame,. etc. will be public?
msgSnippet: ... That s an interesting point, I hadn t thought of it. You are right that native asserts are indeed different from test asserts but maybe an exception could
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Elliotte Harold

> OK. I can see that, but I think that's a very bad idea. A
> JUnit assertion test failure is not at all the same thing as
> a Java language assert failure. They are two different things
> and they should be distinguishable.

That's an interesting point, I hadn't thought of it.

You are right that native asserts are indeed different from test asserts but
maybe an exception could be made for this special case. The possibility of
using a native construct of the language is too good to pass up, even if it
is limited (you still want to use specialized methods to test array or
collection equality).

--
CÃ©dric
http://testng.org
